noun.description: A strap, or set of straps, attached at one end to the noseband (standing martingale) or reins (running martingale) of a horse and at the other end to the girth. It is used to prevent the horse from raising its head too high.
A gambling system of continually doubling the stakes in the hope of an eventual win that must yield a net profit.

origin: Late 16th century: from French, from Spanish almártaga, from Arabic al-martaa the fastening, influenced by martingale, from Occitan martegal inhabitant of Martigues (in Provence).
